column4: I have a seriously broken breezy->edgy upgrade on a server with software RAID1 as the root partition, anyone want to slog through it with me?
u shouldnt have done a breezy > edgy
no shit
dapper to edgy is leaving many people with badly broken systems
breezy to edgy must be a hundered times as bad
do a fresh reinstall
download an edgy alt cd and do a fresh install
what's different about the alt CD that would make it work to see the drives?  Just asking before I spend 2 hrs downloading the ISO
its not about the alt cd. u can use the live if u want. its just that a fresh install always has no problems whereas an upgrade is just filled with broken crap

it's worse than that, though, booting from the kernel on a live 6.10 CD, it can't access the SATA drives (they spew out handling errors to the console), yet booting from 2.6.10 on Knoppix CD lets me see and access everything with no errors
what about a 6.06 live cd ?
or a 6.06 alt cd ?
i recommend u keep 6.06 upgrading to edgy is just not worth it at the moment
maybe when the first big  update line for 6.10 comes out (6.10.1 i guess) then u can update
i have no idea. no one else seems to have this problem. my own SATA drive is perfectly recognized and partitioned
do u have windows ?
you mean a windows install CD?  yes, though I'd have to go find it
no i mean windows installed on your computer ?
no
i had a similar problem once (dapper live dint recognize my hard disk) and i booted windows and did all the partitioning in Partition Magic and reinserted the live cd and everything worked
good luck mate
